intro: Serjania paradoxa f. subvelutina, commonly known as the velvet serjania, is a flowering plant belonging to the family Malvaceae. It is characterized by its distinctive velvety texture on its leaves and stems, which gives it its common name. The plant produces showy, clustered flowers that are typically pink to reddish in color. It is native to Brazil and thrives in tropical and subtropical climates. Due to its ornamental value, it is occasionally cultivated in gardens and botanical collections.
